Quote: There was a manifesto in the late '60s/early '70s, and it basically laid out what 'black art' was and that it should embrace black history and black culture. There were all these rules - I was shocked, when I found it in a book, that it even existed, that it would demarcate these artists.
Author: Kara Walker

Quote: Men of age object too much, consult too long, adventure too little, repent too soon, and seldom drive business home to the full period, but content themselves with a mediocrity of success.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: The worst enemy of human hope is not brute facts, but men of brains who will not face them.
Author: Max Eastman

Quote: Every time I've done comedy in, like, traditional comedy clubs, there's always these comedians that do really well with audiences but that the other comedians hate because they're just, you know, doing kind of cheap stuff like dancing around or doing, like, very kind of base sex humor a lot, and stuff like that.
Author: Aziz Ansari

Quote: I used to think that the worst thing in life was to end up alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel alone.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart and the senses.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: I wasn't exposed to art as I was growing up, and can't recall the first time I saw a work of art. However, I remember very clearly a vision I had of a little green reindeer when I was a child, and visions emanate from the same mythical area where painting resides. Whatever the reason, I immediately felt comfortable working with visual materials.
Author: William S. Burroughs

Quote: Passion is what gives meaning to our lives. It's what allows us to achieve success beyond our wildest imagination. Try to find a career path that you have a passion for.
Author: Henry Samueli

Quote: When you're doing an out-and-out comedy, the notion of preparing for a character - I hope I don't reveal too much of myself here - but, uh, no, I'm not doing anything.
Author: Will Ferrell

Quote: I think great humor lies in playing the truth of a situation. I see myself as a performer and that applies to a Greek drama or a modern comedy.
Author: Brendan Coyle

Quote: Memories are the best things in life, I think.
Author: Romy Schneider

Quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: I have trouble with modern art. But in general, all art forms fascinate me - art is the way human beings express what we can't say in words.
Author: Andrea Bocelli

Quote: To measure the success of our societies, we should examine how well those with different abilities, including persons with autism, are integrated as full and valued members.
Author: Ban Ki-moon

Quote: The atheist has no hope.
Author: James Freeman Clarke

Quote: It's an amusing idea to some, this feminism thing - this audacious notion that women should be able to move through the world as freely, and enjoy the same inalienable rights and bodily autonomy, as men. At least, that's the impression given when feminism and feminists are all too often the targets of lazy humor.
Author: Roxane Gay

Quote: In this life struggle, here I am among you fully cognizant that a true believer has no fear of what God has ordained for him. Those who are visited by fear live only for their present, under the illusion that the world began with them and will end with their departure.
Author: King Hussein I

Quote: The work of art is always unfaithful to its creator... Art lays at a higher level; it says something more, and almost always, it says something different from what the artist wanted to say.
Author: Octavio Paz

Quote: I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in my life. And I am horribly limited.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in my life. And I am horribly limited.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: I am an enthusiast, but not a crank in the sense that I have some pet theories as to the proper construction of a flying machine. I wish to avail myself of all that is already known and then, if possible, add my mite to help on the future worker who will attain final success.
Author: Wilbur Wright

Quote: I hope to stay unemployed as a war photographer till the end of my life.
Author: Robert Capa

Quote: If you look at 'The Best Man,' there's a lot of humor in that, but I never consider that movie a comedy. I felt that it was a drama with comedic elements and comedic parts to it.
Author: Malcolm D. Lee

Quote: Life isn't black and white. It's a million gray areas, don't you find?
Author: Ridley Scott

Quote: Love is space and time measured by the heart.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: They teach you there's a boundary line to music. But, man, there's no boundary line to art.
Author: Charlie Parker

Quote: I have had all of the disadvantages required for success.
Author: Larry Ellison

Quote: One of my defining beliefs is that Jesus Christ has taken all of my guilt before God, and that he has been raised from the dead. That gives incredible hope and meaning to every day of my life - that nothing done in this world is wasted when it's done for him and his glory, and that there will be a day of justice and reward for the entire world.
Author: Joshua Harris

Quote: The rejection that we all take and the sadness and the aggravation and the loss of jobs and all of the things that we live through in our lives, without a sense of humor, I don't know how people make it.
Author: Marlo Thomas

Quote: Life is short, the art long.
Author: Hippocrates

Quote: Life is short, the art long.
Author: Hippocrates

Quote: Let no one who loves be unhappy, even love unreturned has its rainbow.
Author: James M. Barrie

Quote: Philosophy and Art both render the invisible visible by imagination.
Author: George Henry Lewes

Quote: I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: You cannot climb the ladder of success dressed in the costume of failure.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: One day I hope to open my own day-care center. My passion for kids is through the roof.
Author: Cam Newton

Quote: People with a sense of humor tend to be less egocentric and more realistic in their view of the world and more humble in moments of success and less defeated in times of travail.
Author: Bob Newhart

Quote: People with a sense of humor tend to be less egocentric and more realistic in their view of the world and more humble in moments of success and less defeated in times of travail.
Author: Bob Newhart

Quote: It's never nice to lose someone close to you; unfortunately, life goes on, and we have to make peace with it and move on.
Author: Francois Hougaard

Quote: Love is the difficult realization that something other than oneself is real.
Author: Iris Murdoch

Quote: Art is a critical component in a well-rounded education. Art is the level playing field - no matter how rich or poor, tall or short, pretty or ugly to the bone, if you can draw, you can find personal fulfillment and build self-confidence. Art is the highest achievement of mankind.
Author: Lynda Resnick

Quote: Well-behaved women seldom make history.
Author: Laurel Thatcher Ulrich,  Well-Behaved Women Seldom Make History

Quote: We were all born with a certain degree of power. The key to success is discovering this innate power and using it daily to deal with whatever challenges come our way.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: I hope that people learn from my mistake and I hope that the fans forgive me.
Author: Rafael Palmeiro

Quote: The nation that complacently and fearfully allows its artists and writers to become suspected rather than respected is no longer regarded as a nation possessed with humor or depth.
Author: James Thurber

Quote: Success comes to those who dedicate everything to their passion in life. To be successful, it is also very important to be humble and never let fame or money travel to your head.
Author: A. R. Rahman

Quote: Success comes to those who dedicate everything to their passion in life. To be successful, it is also very important to be humble and never let fame or money travel to your head.
Author: A. R. Rahman

Quote: There is no remedy for love but to love more.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Art and Religion are, then, two roads by which men escape from circumstance to ecstasy. Between aesthetic and religious rapture there is a family alliance. Art and Religion are means to similar states of mind.
Author: Clive Bell

Quote: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: I've always competed in those shows. Like, I won 'Fear Factor', I did 'I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here', I did 'The Mole', 'Celebrity Apprentice' with Donald Trump. I've done a lot of those shows, all in the hope of being a blessing to my mom's organization.
Author: Stephen Baldwin

Quote: I get asked, 'How can you have such failures in your films?' Well, what else is life about? There's some sense of constant failure in something. Humor gives you a distance from it.
Author: Alexander Payne

Quote: They tell us that suicide is the greatest piece of cowardice... that suicide is wrong; when it is quite obvious that there is nothing in the world to which every man has a more unassailable title than to his own life and person.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: A pair of powerful spectacles has sometimes sufficed to cure a person in love.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I think that that's why artists make art - it is difficult to put into words unless you are a poet. What it takes is being open to the flow of universal creativity. The Zen artists knew this.
Author: Alex Grey

Quote: Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
Author: Bill Bradley

Quote: Albert Camus, a great humanist and existentialist voice, pointed out that to commit to a just cause with no hope of success is absurd. But then, he also noted that not committing to a just cause is equally absurd. But only one choice offers the possibility for dignity. And dignity matters. Dignity matters.
Author: David Simon

Quote: Albert Camus, a great humanist and existentialist voice, pointed out that to commit to a just cause with no hope of success is absurd. But then, he also noted that not committing to a just cause is equally absurd. But only one choice offers the possibility for dignity. And dignity matters. Dignity matters.
Author: David Simon

Quote: Men love it. They have a sense of humor, whereas a lot of women are threatened or just don't get it.
Author: Lara Flynn Boyle

Quote: It's only when we truly know and understand that we have a limited time on earth - and that we have no way of knowing when our time is up, we will then begin to live each day to the fullest, as if it was the only one we had.
Author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

Quote: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.
Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

Quote: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.
Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

Quote: I got my first camera when I was 21 - my boyfriend gave it to me for my birthday - but at that point politics was my life, and I viewed the camera as a tool for expressing my political beliefs rather than as an art medium.
Author: Carrie Mae Weems

Quote: The road to success is always under construction.
Author: Arnold Palmer

Quote: I do a lot of inspirational talks for kids, to motivate them to change their lives and give them hope.
Author: Adam Beach

Quote: I do a lot of inspirational talks for kids, to motivate them to change their lives and give them hope.
Author: Adam Beach

Quote: I don't really dissect comedy. Nothing kills off humor more than overanalyzing it.
Author: David Steinberg

Quote: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
Author: Socrates

Quote: A performance art piece is unprecedented. It is difficult to censor since it has a good possibility of never being done before.
Author: Jack Bowman

Quote: Learning and innovation go hand in hand. The arrogance of success is to think that what you did yesterday will be sufficient for tomorrow.
Author: William Pollard

Quote: My mother told me, 'Son, nobody else but God knows.' And that's what I'm about - reaching out to the people, crying with them, giving them hope. Visiting the hospital, visiting the kids with cancer, visiting the adults, and stuff like that. That's what I do.
Author: Mr. T

Quote: I came into the 'Comedy Bang! Bang!' TV show with a level of confidence that I don't think I would've had if I hadn't been doing the podcast for three years already. I certainly had to figure out in those three years the sense of humor I wanted to do and the way to talk to celebrities without being incredibly intimidated by them.
Author: Scott Aukerman

Quote: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale.
Author: Hans Christian Andersen

Quote: I'm not saying that love always takes you to heaven. Your life can become a nightmare. But that said, it is worth taking the risk.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: There is something about giving everything to your profession. In Italian, an obsession is not necessarily negative. It's the art of putting all your energy into one thing; it's the art of transforming even what you eat for lunch into architecture.
Author: Renzo Piano

Quote: I do not think there is any thrill that can go through the human heart like that felt by the inventor as he sees some creation of the brain unfolding to success... such emotions make a man forget food, sleep, friends, love, everything.
Author: Nikola Tesla

Quote: I do not think there is any thrill that can go through the human heart like that felt by the inventor as he sees some creation of the brain unfolding to success... such emotions make a man forget food, sleep, friends, love, everything.
Author: Nikola Tesla

Quote: I really subscribe to that old adage that you should never let the audience get ahead of you for a second. So if the film's abrasive and wrongfoots people then, y'know, that's great. But I hope it involves an audience.
Author: Paul Thomas Anderson

Quote: As fandom grew more variegated, genzines reflected a broadening of interests, carrying personal columns of humor and reflection, science articles, amateur fiction, stylish gossip, and inevitably, thoughtful pieces on the future of fandom.
Author: Gregory Benford

Quote: A baby is God's opinion that life should go on.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Graffiti's always been a temporary art form. You make your mark and then they scrub it off.
Author: Banksy

Quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
Author: Charles William Eliot

Quote: Success is the sum of small efforts - repeated day in and day out.
Author: Robert Collier

Quote: They look quite promising in the shop; and not entirely without hope when I get them back into my wardrobe. But then, when I put them on they tend to deteriorate with a very strange rapidity and one feels so sorry for them.
Author: Joyce Grenfell

Quote: I don't think I could ever do a network sitcom because the humor is often based on some trite circumstance. I don't want to be a part of a show where it's mostly about coming up with the jokes.
Author: Sherilyn Fenn

Quote: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Before I met my husband, I'd never fallen in love. I'd stepped in it a few times.
Author: Rita Rudner

Quote: Religion is the everlasting dialogue between humanity and God. Art is its soliloquy.
Author: Franz Werfel

Quote: Successful people make money. It's not that people who make money become successful, but that successful people attract money. They bring success to what they do.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: With the sugar market hysteria, the people are obviously worried and expect higher inflation. When this hysteria subsides, which we're probably observing, then I hope that people will also get less worried about the future of inflation.
Author: Marek Belka

Quote: Colombian humor is very black, very sarcastic.
Author: Barbet Schroeder

Quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life; define yourself.
Author: Harvey Fierstein

Quote: Love means to love that which is unlovable; or it is no virtue at all.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: Art to me is an anecdote of the spirit, and the only means of making concrete the purpose of its varied quickness and stillness.
Author: Mark Rothko

Quote: A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading.
Author: William Styron,  Conversations with William Styron

Quote: Our success educationally, industrially and politically is based upon the protection of a nation founded by ourselves. And the nation can be nowhere else but in Africa.
Author: Marcus Garvey

Quote: I hope girls read what I say in interviews - they should just be themselves.
Author: Taylor Momsen

Quote: People come up to me as I leave the stage after a performance and tell me tey saw my mother onstage with me every time I sing. I keep a sense of humor about it.
Author: Lorna Luft

Quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
Author: Buddha

Quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
Author: Lord Byron

Quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
Author: Lord Byron

Quote: In the practical art of war, the best thing of all is to take the enemy's country whole and intact; to shatter and destroy it is not so good.
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: You can never be overdressed or overeducated.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Never continue in a job you don't enjoy. If you're happy in what you're doing, you'll like yourself, you'll have inner peace. And if you have that, along with physical health, you will have had more success than you could possibly have imagined.
Author: Johnny Carson

Quote: Hope makes people good, a lot of the time. You hope for a brighter future, and resentment is outweighed.
Author: Daisy Ridley

Quote: I learned early in my career to not let myself get in the way of humor but, instead, find what is great in a talented person.
Author: Tamra Davis

Quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
Author: Marie Curie

Quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
Author: Marie Curie

Quote: The love we have in our youth is superficial compared to the love that an old man has for his old wife.
Author: Will Durant

Quote: Cunning is the art of concealing our own defects, and discovering other people's weaknesses.
Author: William Hazlitt

Quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I'm an addict, I'm addicted to success. Thankfully, there's no rehab for success.
Author: Lil Wayne

Quote: 'Halal in the Family' will expose a broad audience to some of the realities of being Muslim in America. By using satire, we will encourage people to reconsider their assumptions about Muslims, while providing a balm to those experiencing anti-Muslim bias. I also hope those Uncles and Aunties out there will crack a smile!
Author: Aasif Mandvi

Quote: Quite often, intent on conveying how things can go wrong for a culture (science fiction) or an individual (horror) or all of magical creation (fantasy), works of fantastika often preclude comedy, because humor gets in the way of messages of doom or struggle.
Author: Paul Di Filippo

Quote: Life is too short for long-term grudges.
Author: Elon Musk

Quote: Love is... never asking for more than you are prepared to give.
Author: Kim Casali

Quote: Courtesy is a silver lining around the dark clouds of civilization; it is the best part of refinement and in many ways, an art of heroic beauty in the vast gallery of man's cruelty and baseness.
Author: Bryant H. McGill

Quote: Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: The secret of your success is determined by your daily agenda.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: There is in every child at every stage a new miracle of vigorous unfolding, which constitutes a new hope and a new responsibility for all.
Author: Erik Erikson

Quote: My uncle worked in emergency wards dealing with people who came in with terrible injuries. He talked about the sketch shows they would put on to lighten the atmosphere. You often find this sense of grim humor in hospitals. The injuries people are suffering are ghastly. You have to laugh at something or you'd otherwise cry.
Author: Honeysuckle Weeks

Quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
Author: Hubert H. Humphrey

Quote: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
Author: Hubert H. Humphrey

Quote: Art is the most beautiful of all lies.
Author: Claude Debussy

Quote: I don't want to be a man,"said Jace. "I want to be an angst-ridden teenager who can't confront his own inner demons and takes it out verbally on other people instead.""Well,"said Luke, "you're doing a fantastic job.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: Part of being a man is learning to take responsibility for your successes and for your failures. You can't go blaming others or being jealous. Seeing somebody else's success as your failure is a cancerous way to live.
Author: Kevin Bacon

Quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.
Author: Gustave Courbet

Quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.
Author: Gustave Courbet

Quote: I'm looking at some comedic horror films because I have often been accused of being too dark. I'm not dark, not compared with 'Saw' or anything like that. So I'm looking at live-action horror films, but not slasher ones - ones that have humor and maybe some social satire.
Author: Henry Selick

Quote: The only disability in life is a bad attitude.
Author: Scott Hamilton

Quote: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, 'I love you.'
Author: Billy Graham

Quote: No great art has ever been made without the artist having known danger.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: Challenge is the pathway to engagement and progress in our lives. But not all challenges are created equal. Some challenges make us feel alive, engaged, connected, and fulfilled. Others simply overwhelm us. Knowing the difference as you set bigger and bolder challenges for yourself is critical to your sanity, success, and satisfaction.
Author: Brendon Burchard

Quote: Hope begins in the dark, the stubborn hope that if you just show up and try to do the right thing, the dawn will come. You wait and watch and work: you don't give up.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: Humor that is edgy is never squeaky clean.
Author: Jeff Ross

Quote: Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the thinker what he thinks into it.
Author: Ernest Holmes

Quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Art is a way to express yourself and through that you can escape a bad situation.
Author: Russell Simmons

Quote: No one succeeds without effort... Those who succeed owe their success to perseverance.
Author: Ramana Maharshi

Quote: It would be fun to do a reunion show. I hope we do it some day, but it better be soon. We're all getting on.
Author: William Christopher

Quote: Humor is always more interesting when it comes from someone who's had more than, like, five experiences.
Author: Mallory Ortberg

Quote: Life is a lot like jazz... it's best when you improvise.
Author: George Gershwin

Quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
Author: Francis of Assisi

Quote: Some songs you get. Some songs you may not. And I think that's the beauty of art: to question and to ask, to understand the deeper meaning after two or three or four listenings.
Author: Janelle Monae

Quote: My powers are ordinary. Only my application brings me success.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: On what rests the hope of the republic? One country, one language, one flag!
Author: Alexander Henry

Quote: I want everything I do to have humor in it, because it seems to me that all of life has that.
Author: Lawrence Kasdan

Quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The beauty of a woman must be seen from in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Cultural confinement takes place when a curator imposes his own limits on an art exhibition, rather than asking an artist to set his limits.
Author: Robert Smithson

Quote: If you don't know where you're going, any road'll take you there
Author: George Harrison

Quote: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
Author: W. Clement Stone

Quote: Posterity! You will never know how much it cost the present generation to preserve your freedom! I hope you will make a good use of it.
Author: John Adams

Quote: I appreciate humor so much, but I'm actually not a funny girl.
Author: Emmanuelle Chriqui

Quote: Life will always be to a large extent what we ourselves make it.
Author: Samuel Smiles

Quote: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
Author: Bradley Whitford

Quote: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
Author: Bradley Whitford

Quote: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
Author: Bradley Whitford

Quote: Nature is the art of God.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quote: The Seven Social Sins are: Wealth without work. Pleasure without conscience. Knowledge without character. Commerce without morality. Science without humanity. Worship without sacrifice. Politics without principle.
Author: Frederick Lewis Donaldson

Quote: The Seven Social Sins are: Wealth without work. Pleasure without conscience. Knowledge without character. Commerce without morality. Science without humanity. Worship without sacrifice. Politics without principle.
Author: Frederick Lewis Donaldson

Quote: The Seven Social Sins are: Wealth without work. Pleasure without conscience. Knowledge without character. Commerce without morality. Science without humanity. Worship without sacrifice. Politics without principle.
Author: Frederick Lewis Donaldson

Quote: The secret of success is sincerity.
Author: Jean Giraudoux

Quote: Where I am today... I still have my ups and downs, but I take it one day at a time and I just hope that I can be the best that I can possibly be, not only for myself, but also young people that are out there today that need someone to look up to.
Author: Demi Lovato

Quote: Ad agencies do all kinds of market research that ask people what they think they want, and instead, you should be creating things that you want. If you do something and you get it, the rest of the world will get it, too. Trust your own instincts, your own intellect, and your own sense of humor.
Author: George Lois

Quote: Once you bring life into the world, you must protect it. We must protect it by changing the world.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
Author: George Sand

Quote: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
Author: George Sand

Quote: I think most of the people involved in any art always secretly wonder whether they are really there because they're good or there because they're lucky.
Author: Katharine Hepburn

Quote: Love is needing someone. Love is putting up with someone's bad qualities because they somehow complete you.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  This Lullaby

Quote: Failure is success if we learn from it.
Author: Malcolm Forbes

Quote: Professionalism in art has this difficulty: To be professional is to be dependable, to be dependable is to be predictable, and predictability is esthetically boring - an anti-virtue in a field where we hope to be astonished and startled and at some deep level refreshed.
Author: John Updike

Quote: Professionalism in art has this difficulty: To be professional is to be dependable, to be dependable is to be predictable, and predictability is esthetically boring - an anti-virtue in a field where we hope to be astonished and startled and at some deep level refreshed.
Author: John Updike

Quote: My fans have great senses of humor and eat too much chocolate.
Author: Christopher Moore

Quote: A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body - the wishbone.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.
Author: Sai Baba

Quote: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.
Author: Sai Baba

Quote: I think it's the pain and suffering that drive you to become an artist. The art itself should be the pain, sort of exorcising every demon and making you feel like you're a person that matters.
Author: Marilyn Manson

Quote: It's our nature: Human beings like success but they hate successful people.
Author: Carrot Top

Quote: Hope is the only good that is common to all men; those who have nothing else possess hope still.
Author: Thales

Quote: Short fiction is like low relief. And if your story has no humor in it, then you're trying to look at something in the pitch dark. With the light of humor, it throws what you're writing into relief so that you can actually see it.
Author: Elizabeth McCracken

Quote: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The love of family and the admiration of friends is much more important than wealth and privilege.
Author: Charles Kuralt

Quote: Translation is the art of failure.
Author: Umberto Eco

Quote: All men's gains are the fruit of venturing.
Author: Herodotus

Quote: Over the years I've learned how to lock myself up in a prison of hope, knowing that God has nothing but His best planned for me. He promised me things concerning my ministry and my life.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: There are two MFA programs here at the University of Texas, and I read on the jury of both of them. And it's amazing to me how many really talented young writers seem to fear humor.
Author: Elizabeth McCracken

Quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
Author: Havelock Ellis

Quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
Author: Havelock Ellis

Quote: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into friend.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into friend.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Thought is more important than art. To revere art and have no understanding of the process that forces it into existence, is finally not even to understand what art is.
Author: Amiri Baraka

Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: It is in the admission of ignorance and the admission of uncertainty that there is a hope for the continuous motion of human beings in some direction that doesn't get confined, permanently blocked, as it has so many times before in various periods in the history of man.
Author: Richard P. Feynman

Quote: I'm going to do a lot of weird stuff that's not going to be like me prancing around like an insane 12-year-old. I showed everybody that side of me and I think it's time to do different stuff, even when it comes down to the type of humor. I want to do some drier, weirder stuff.
Author: Andy Milonakis

Quote: To live is to change, and to be perfect is to have changed often.
Author: John Henry Newman

Quote: A birthday is just another day where you go to work and people give you love. Age is just a state of mind, and you are as old as you think you are. You have to count your blessings and be happy.
Author: Abhishek Bachchan

Quote: Advertising is fundamentally persuasion and persuasion happens to be not a science, but an art.
Author: William Bernbach

Quote: It's not enough that I should succeed - others should fail.
Author: David Merrick

Quote: If it is nothingness that awaits us, let us make an injustice of it; let us fight against destiny, even though without hope of victory.
Author: Miguel de Unamuno

Quote: Conservative humor is frankly harder than liberal humor. You get points for just being liberal. You can get more points if you make fun of your own side sometimes.
Author: Ted Rall

Quote: No man is a failure who is enjoying life.
Author: William Feather

Quote: Don't aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
Author: David Frost

Quote: Don't aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
Author: David Frost

Quote: American art in general... takes to surreal exaggerations and metaphors; but its Puritan work ethic has little use for the playful self-indulgence behind Parisian Surrealism.
Author: John Updike

Quote: The one phrase you can use is that success has a thousand fathers, and failure is an orphan.
Author: Alan Price

Quote: I'm still like a butterfly going from one job to another job. But it's quite lovely - I hope to keep this freedom, to have fun.
Author: Carine Roitfeld

Quote: The way humor's usually used in horror, it's as a pressure-release valve; without it, the drama would escalate out of all control almost immediately.
Author: Stephen Graham Jones

Quote: What is important in life is life, and not the result of life.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Love myself I do. Not everything, but I love the good as well as the bad. I love my crazy lifestyle, and I love my hard discipline. I love my freedom of speech and the way my eyes get dark when I'm tired. I love that I have learned to trust people with my heart, even if it will get broken. I am proud of everything that I am and will become.
Author: Johnny Weir

Quote: I'm into sincerity in music and sincerity in art. If it doesn't feel true, I don't want to do it. Things that are too dramatic scare me. I think that's why I don't always fit into the world of performing arts.
Author: Zooey Deschanel

Quote: Obedience is the mother of success and is wedded to safety.
Author: Aeschylus

Quote: Hope and purpose in this world is living as best as you can and maybe having life that gives back. But simply giving back isn't purpose; it's a branch of purpose, but it is not the trunk or root of the tree.
Author: Nick Vujicic

Quote: I think Canadian humor is a little less broad than American humor.
Author: Scott Thompson

Quote: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Art has a double visage: it looks before and after. Romance is its forward-looking face. The germ of growth is in romanticism. Formalism, on the other hand, consolidates tradition; gleans what has been gained and makes it facile to the hand or the mind; economizes the energy of genius.
Author: George Edward Woodberry

Quote: The one thing that I know is that you win with good people.
Author: Don Shula

Quote: I hope for the day when everyone can speak again of God without embarrassment.
Author: Paul Tillich

Quote: I think the Canadian sense of humor is dryer than America's and juicier than Britain's. I think it's a cross between the two of them, really.
Author: Scott Thompson

Quote: Nobody got where they are today by living for tomorrow.
Author: Tom Wilson

Quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back they're yours; if they don't they never were.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: The art of medicine was to be properly learned only from its practice and its exercise.
Author: Thomas Sydenham

Quote: The victor belongs to the spoils.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: I'm hopeful. I know there is a lot of ambition in Washington, obviously. But I hope the ambitious realize that they are more likely to succeed with success as opposed to failure.
Author: George W. Bush

Quote: I'm hopeful. I know there is a lot of ambition in Washington, obviously. But I hope the ambitious realize that they are more likely to succeed with success as opposed to failure.
Author: George W. Bush

Quote: Any good humor is sophomoric. 'Sophomoric' is the liberal word for funny.
Author: Michael O'Donoghue

Quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is only one secure foundation: a genuine, deep relationship with Jesus Christ, which will carry you through any and all turmoil. No matter what storms are raging all around, you'll stand firm if you stand on His love.
Author: Charles Stanley

Quote: Every great work of art has two faces, one toward its own time and one toward the future, toward eternity.
Author: Lester Bangs

Quote: Success is the progressive realization of predetermined, worthwhile, personal goals.
Author: Paul J. Meyer

Quote: I did nothing to deserve God's love; in fact, I was living as an orphan, without hope. Yet God chose to pursue a relationship with me, and through the death of his son Jesus, I was adopted into God's family.
Author: Steven Curtis Chapman

Quote: For the most part, comedians are pretty friendly with each other. They always say they badmouth each other, but most of the time, they're friends. We're the only ones that can really stand our type of humor.
Author: Colin Quinn

Quote: We can't plan life. All we can do is be available for it.
Author: Lauryn Hill

Quote: I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.
Author: Arthur Rubinstein

Quote: I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.
Author: Arthur Rubinstein

Quote: Some people have been kind enough to call me a fine artist. I've always called myself an illustrator. I'm not sure what the difference is. All I know is that whatever type of work I do, I try to give it my very best. Art has been my life.
Author: Norman Rockwell

Quote: Whatever success I may have attained is due to the fact that since I was old enough to work at all, my ambition has never deserted me.
Author: Anna Held

Quote: It is true that power corrupts. The hope at the polling stations and the actions of the elected representatives, unfortunately, often turn to be opposite. The power of ballot turns into the power of wallet. Some law-makers become law-breakers.
Author: Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj

Quote: Religious humor is not really my area, so I probably wouldn't do anything about that, or politics or something.
Author: Chris Lilley

Quote: If you truly believe in the value of life, you care about all of the weakest and most vulnerable members of society.
Author: Joni Eareckson Tada

Quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Because it's so easy to medicate our need for self-worth by pandering to win followers, 'likes' and view counts, social media have become the metier of choice for many people who might otherwise channel that energy into books, music or art - or even into their own Web ventures.
Author: Neil Strauss

Quote: I am not pretty. I am not beautiful. I am as radiant as the sun.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

Quote: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
Author: William Feather

Quote: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
Author: Stendhal

Quote: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
Author: Stendhal

Quote: I wish I could be as thin as Jessica Simpson. I think she looks gorgeous! I have had Jessica on my show several times, and I can tell you that girl is genuine and funny with a great self-deprecating sense of humor.
Author: Rachael Ray

Quote: A lot of life is dealing with your curse, dealing with the cards you were given that aren't so nice. Does it make you into a monster, or can you temper it in some way, or accept it and go in some other direction?
Author: Wes Craven

Quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: I'm not really sure what social message my art carries, if any. And I don't really want it to carry one. I'm not interested in the subject matter to try to teach society anything, or to try to better our world in any way.
Author: Roy Lichtenstein

Quote: There is no substitute for victory.
Author: Douglas MacArthur

Quote: I hope the fans have enjoyed listening as much as I've enjoyed doing the games. I don't ever go to the park where I don't have a good day. I don't like losing. But I don't think I ever go to the park where I have a bad day. I don't think once.
Author: Bob Uecker

Quote: After spending 460 days as a hostage, I did emerge a fundamentally changed person. But I think, like everyone does as they grow older and probably wiser, I can look back at my earlier life - my history, my mistakes, the joy I felt as a young woman traveling the world - with some objectivity and even some humor.
Author: Amanda Lindhout

Quote: I think the best thing for you to do is just live your life. Live a life that's worth living, one where you do what you want to do, pursue your passions. That way, if you meet someone, they'll be joining a life that's already really good.
Author: Dan Savage

Quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Everyone in those days expected that art students were wild, licentious characters. We didn't know how to be, but we sure were anxious to learn.
Author: Norman Rockwell

Quote: How can they say my life is not a success? Have I not for more than sixty years got enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
Author: Logan Pearsall Smith

Quote: The point about hope is that it is something that occurs in very dark moments. It is like a flame in the darkness; it isn't like a confidence and a promise.
Author: John Berger

Quote: I did the 'Bionic Woman,' which of course had a lot of humor in it, and that was really a function of a lot of the ad-libbing and the things that I did in it.
Author: Lindsay Wagner

Quote: I try to show the public that chemistry, biology, physics, astrophysics is life. It is not some separate subject that you have to be pulled into a corner to be taught about.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: God wants us to know that life is a series of beginnings, not endings. Just as graduations are not terminations, but commencements. Creation is an ongoing process, and when we create a perfect world where love and compassion are shared by all, suffering will cease.
Author: Bernie Siegel

Quote: God wants us to know that life is a series of beginnings, not endings. Just as graduations are not terminations, but commencements. Creation is an ongoing process, and when we create a perfect world where love and compassion are shared by all, suffering will cease.
Author: Bernie Siegel

Quote: I am an artisan. I only became an artist when people watch what I do. That is when it becomes art.
Author: Rhys Ifans

Quote: Diligence is the mother of good fortune.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: It is only by not paying one's bills that one can hope to live in the memory of the commercial classes.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I've always had a sick sense of humor, and I've always wanted that to permeate the music because I don't take myself seriously. I take the music seriously, but I know I'm not God's gift to anyone except my mom.
Author: Josh Homme

Quote: No, there's nothing half so sweet in life as love's young dream.
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: No, there's nothing half so sweet in life as love's young dream.
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Making sushi is an art, and experience is everything.
Author: Nobu Matsuhisa

Quote: In order to succeed you must fail, so that you know what not to do the next time.
Author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

Quote: People are basically the same the world over. Everybody wants the same things - to be happy, to be healthy, to be at least reasonably prosperous, and to be secure. They want friends, peace of mind, good family relationships, and hope that tomorrow is going to be even better than today.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Since I became a knitting humor writer, I seem to be understood a little better - at least for the purposes of social discourse.
Author: Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

Quote: A lot of my life happened in great, wonderful bursts of good fortune, and then I would race to be worthy of it.
Author: Julie Andrews

Quote: Mama was my greatest teacher, a teacher of compassion, love and fearlessness. If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.
Author: Stevie Wonder

Quote: Life is an illusion. I am held together in the nothingness by art.
Author: Anselm Kiefer

Quote: All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

Quote: All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

Quote: All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

Quote: Don't confuse fame with success. Madonna is one; Helen Keller is the other.
Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: I would describe myself as emotional and highly strung. If something upsets me, it really upsets me. If something makes me angry, I get really angry. But it's all very upfront. I can't hide it. I'm also loyal and I hope I'm fun.
Author: Nicole Kidman

Quote: Jerry Seinfeld is amazing in many ways, not the least of them his ability to find humor, and convincing us to find it, too, in the million-and-two details about modern life that under different circumstances might send us into paroxysms of rage.
Author: Tom Shales

Quote: Self-respect permeates every aspect of your life.
Author: Joe Clark

Quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
Author: Euripides

Quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
Author: Euripides

Quote: At no point do I wish to be in conflict with any man or masculine thought. It doesn't enter my consciousness. Art is anonymous. It's not competitive with men. It's a complementary contribution.
Author: Barbara Hepworth

Quote: A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
Author: Anne Frank,  Anne Frank's Tales from the Secret Annex

Quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
Author: Anne Frank,  Anne Frank's Tales from the Secret Annex

Quote: Can you imagine what I would do if I could do all I can?
Author: Jeff Rich

Quote: Love, hope, fear, faith - these make humanity; These are its sign and note and character.
Author: Robert Browning

Quote: Any film which views the darker side of life, which is death with a sense of humor, is very much to my taste.
Author: Carter Burwell

Quote: No man has a right to expect to succeed in life unless he understands his business, and nobody can understand his business thoroughly unless he learns it by personal application and experience.
Author: P. T. Barnum

Quote: The more often we see the things around us - even the beautiful and wonderful things - the more they become invisible to us. That is why we often take for granted the beauty of this world: the flowers, the trees, the birds, the clouds - even those we love. Because we see things so often, we see them less and less.
Author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

Quote: Art and nature shall always be wrestling until they eventually conquer one another so that the victory is the same stroke and line: that which is conquered, conquers at the same time.
Author: Maria Sibylla Merian

Quote: Success is the one unpardonable sin against our fellows.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: The most insignificant people are the most apt to sneer at others. They are safe from reprisals. And have no hope of rising in their own self esteem but by lowering their neighbors.
Author: William Hazlitt

Quote: I wish there were more humor in my work than I see in it.
Author: Jasper Johns

Quote: To kind of go through life not caring is a spectacular attribute. It's one I wish I had.
Author: Neil Cross

Quote: Beauty is when you can appreciate yourself. When you love yourself, that's when you're most beautiful.
Author: Zoe Kravitz

Quote: Art is individualism, and individualism is a disturbing and disintegrating force.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Those who have succeeded at anything and don't mention luck are kidding themselves.
Author: Larry King

Quote: The Worldly Hope men set their Hearts upon Turns Ashes - or it prospers; and anon, Like Snow upon the Desert's dusty Face, Lighting a little hour or two - is gone.
Author: Omar Khayyam

Quote: Even as a kid I was never the generator of humor, but I always knew who was funny, who to hang out with.
Author: Andrew Stanton

Quote: The contemplative life is often miserable. One must act more, think less, and not watch oneself live.
Author: Nicolas Chamfort

Quote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
Author: Pele

Quote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
Author: Pele

Quote: Bad people are, from the point of view of art, fascinating studies. They represent colour, variety and strangeness. Good people exasperate one's reason; bad people stir one's imagination.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: After I won the Oscar, my salary doubled, my friends tripled, my children became more popular at school, my butcher made a pass at me, and my maid hit me up for a raise.
Author: Shirley Jones

Quote: I love my daddy. My daddy's everything. I hope I can find a man that will treat me as good as my dad.
Author: Lady Gaga

Quote: I try to find humor in everything I do, because I think all great plays - even great tragedies - have enormous humor in them.
Author: Marian Seldes

Quote: I collect art, and I drink wine... things that I like that I had never been exposed to. But I never said, 'I'm going to buy art to impress this crowd.' That's just ridiculous to me. I don't live my life like that, because how could you be happy with yourself?
Author: Jay-Z

Quote: I collect art, and I drink wine... things that I like that I had never been exposed to. But I never said, 'I'm going to buy art to impress this crowd.' That's just ridiculous to me. I don't live my life like that, because how could you be happy with yourself?
Author: Jay-Z

Quote: I am good, but not an angel. I do sin, but I am not the devil. I am just a small girl in a big world trying to find someone to love.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master; thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quote: Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: I no longer believed in the idea of soul mates, or love at first sight. But I was beginning to believe that a very few times in your life, if you were lucky, you might meet someone who was exactly right for you. Not because he was perfect, or because you were, but because your combined flaws were arranged in a way that allowed two separate beings to hinge together.
Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Blue-Eyed Devil

Quote: I no longer believed in the idea of soul mates, or love at first sight. But I was beginning to believe that a very few times in your life, if you were lucky, you might meet someone who was exactly right for you. Not because he was perfect, or because you were, but because your combined flaws were arranged in a way that allowed two separate beings to hinge together.
Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Blue-Eyed Devil

Quote: I no longer believed in the idea of soul mates, or love at first sight. But I was beginning to believe that a very few times in your life, if you were lucky, you might meet someone who was exactly right for you. Not because he was perfect, or because you were, but because your combined flaws were arranged in a way that allowed two separate beings to hinge together.
Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Blue-Eyed Devil

Quote: Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Jingo

Quote: Nothing succeeds like success.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
Author: Emil Zatopek

Quote: I always felt different as a kid, and the Kinks were like, 'Yeah, we're the Kinks.' Celebrate your difference; don't be afraid of your sense of humor, or your personality, or who you are. It emboldened me.
Author: Michael Weatherly

Quote: I can't imagine a person becoming a success who doesn't give this game of life everything he's got.
Author: Walter Cronkite

Quote: I can't imagine a person becoming a success who doesn't give this game of life everything he's got.
Author: Walter Cronkite

Quote: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: What strikes me is the fact that in our society, art has become something which is only related to objects, and not to individuals, or to life.
Author: Michel Foucault

Quote: I don't think about financial success as the measurement of my success.
Author: Christie Hefner

Quote: On every birthday, I ask my wife, 'What would you like this year?' and her instant reply is, 'Diamonds! Diamonds! Diamonds!' I'm always living in hope that one day she'll say she just wants me!
Author: Akshay Kumar

Quote: I have wit in my work and a sense of humor, but I do not use irony in any way.
Author: John Zorn

Quote: It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play.
Author: Dizzy Gillespie

Quote: The great gift of Easter is hope - Christian hope which makes us have that confidence in God, in his ultimate triumph, and in his goodness and love, which nothing can shake.
Author: Basil Hume

Quote: The great gift of Easter is hope - Christian hope which makes us have that confidence in God, in his ultimate triumph, and in his goodness and love, which nothing can shake.
Author: Basil Hume

Quote: Art is the symbol of the two noblest human efforts: to construct and to refrain from destruction.
Author: Evelyn Waugh

Quote: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.
Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version

Quote: This life’s hard, but it’s harder if you’re stupid.
Author: George V. Higgins,  The Friends of Eddie Coyle

Quote: This life’s hard, but it’s harder if you’re stupid.
Author: George V. Higgins,  The Friends of Eddie Coyle

Quote: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
Author: Bessie Anderson Stanley

Quote: I hope climate science becomes the big thing. And then what I want is electrical engineers to solve the world's energy problems, energy distribution problems. I want mechanical engineers to make better transportation systems. I want chemical engineers to develop better solar panels, and so on.
Author: Bill Nye

Quote: My mother was Irish; she had this great sense of humor, and both my parents loved films. There was a very vibrant discourse about politics and everything that was going on in the world where I grew up. So I was genetically predisposed to go into the performing arts.
Author: Martin Donovan

Quote: It is best to be born in April or August when the life-giving Sun is in its exaltation sign Aries or Leo, its home, for then we enter the sea of life on the crest-wave and are backed in the battle of existence by an abundant fund of vim and energy.
Author: Max Heindel

Quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: The chief function of the city is to convert power into form, energy into culture, dead matter into the living symbols of art, biological reproduction into social creativity.
Author: Lewis Mumford

Quote: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
Author: Earl Wilson

Quote: I've had such a satisfying life professionally and personally. I hope my tombstone says, 'Never boring.'
Author: Alan Dershowitz

Quote: All I try to do is as earnestly and as acutely as I can, conceive a character and try to portray this character just honestly. If the humor is within the absurdity and the awfulness of situations, then let it be seen that way.
Author: Patrick Warburton

Quote: If you want to succeed at any job, make yourself invaluable. Go the extra mile; make them never be able to imagine what life without you there would be like.
Author: Ross Mathews

Quote: We must develop and maintain the capacity to forgive. He who is devoid of the power to forgive is devoid of the power to love. There is some good in the worst of us and some evil in the best of us. When we discover this, we are less prone to hate our enemies.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.
Author: E. M. Forster

Quote: Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success.
Author: Joyce Brothers

Quote: A dream is the bearer of a new possibility, the enlarged horizon, the great hope.
Author: Howard Thurman

Quote: I think that humor is part of what saves us from despair.
Author: John Perry Barlow

Quote: I'm just living my life, and I'm not gonna live my life for other people.
Author: Taylor Momsen

Quote: I refuse to accept the view that mankind is so tragically bound to the starless midnight of racism and war that the bright daybreak of peace and brotherhood can never become a reality... I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
Author: Thomas Wolfe

Quote: We should measure welfare's success by how many people leave welfare, not by how many are added.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: The message of Jesus is summed up partly in the Sermon on the Mount, and partly when he begins his ministry and quotes the passage from Isaiah: 'I have come to set free the prisoners and restore sight to the blind.' And certainly, his mission is also to bring hope. It was to heal people, to befriend the outcast.
Author: Dan Wakefield

Quote: As a kid, I loved 'Godot' because of the poetry and the humor and the strangeness, but then as you get older, it's much more resonant.
Author: Nathan Lane

Quote: I don't like dreams or reality. I like when dreams become reality because that is my life.
Author: Jean Paul Gaultier

Quote: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: Trifles make perfection, and perfection is no trifle.
Author: Michelangelo

Quote: Victory has a thousand fathers, but defeat is an orphan.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: The Opera was a very cold film, a hopeless and dark film, no hope, no love.
Author: Dario Argento

Quote: My books are shelved in different places, depending on the bookstore. Sometimes they can be found in the Mystery section, sometimes in the Humor department, and occasionally even in the Literature aisle, which is somewhat astounding.
Author: Carl Hiaasen

Quote: I don't want to be put on a pedestal. I just want to be reasonably successful and live a normal life with all the conveniences to make it so.
Author: Althea Gibson

Quote: But I say to you, Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you, so that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven; for he makes his sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.
Author: Jesus Christ

Quote: Fashion is only the attempt to realize art in living forms and social intercourse.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: Success is blocked by concentrating on it and planning for it... Success is shy - it won't come out while you're watching.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: When you run a part of the relay and pass on the baton, there is no sense of unfinished business in your mind. There is just the sense of having done your part to the best of your ability. That is it. The hope is to pass on the baton to somebody who will run faster and run a better marathon.
Author: N. R. Narayana Murthy

Quote: I don't know if my sense of humor goes over Americans' heads.
Author: Ryan Kwanten

Quote: Life's a bit like mountaineering - never look down.
Author: Edmund Hillary

Quote: We've got this gift of love, but love is like a precious plant. You can't just accept it and leave it in the cupboard or just think it's going to get on by itself. You've got to keep watering it. You've got to really look after it and nurture it.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: I like to pretend that my art has nothing to do with me.
Author: Roy Lichtenstein

Quote: Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quote: It has never been, and never will be easy work! But the road that is built in hope is more pleasant to the traveler than the road built in despair, even though they both lead to the same destination.
Author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

Quote: Mother humor is such a universal theme. I wrote a show called '25 Questions for a Jewish Mother.' I had people coming up to me after the show saying, 'I'm Baptist, and my mother is just like yours.'
Author: Judy Gold

Quote: I don't think anybody should ever take their life for being bullied. But if it wasn't for my family... and my circle of friends, I could definitely see why someone would see it doesn't get any better than this, but it does. Life is so beautiful.
Author: Khloe Kardashian

Quote: I really do believe that God is love, one of deep affection and grace and forgiveness and inspiration.
Author: William P. Young

Quote: Art is the child of Nature; yes, her darling child, in whom we trace the features of the mother's face, her aspect and her attitude.
Author: Beck

Quote: In a balanced organization, working towards a common objective, there is success.
Author: Arthur Helps

Quote: Iranian filmmakers are not passive. They fight whenever they can, as creative expression means a lot to them. The restrictions and censorship in Iran are a bit like the British weather: one day it's sunny, the next day it's raining. You just have to hope you walk out into the sunshine.
Author: Asghar Farhadi

Quote: Hope for the best, survive the worst, find humor wherever you can.
Author: Claire Scovell LaZebnik

Quote: Last Wednesday, I stupidly dropped my iPhone in the bath, and my life has sort of spiraled almost out of control.
Author: Patrick Stewart

Quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Author: Confucius

Quote: I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.
Author: Auguste Rodin

Quote: There's nothing like deep breaths after laughing that hard. Nothing in the world like a sore stomach for the right reasons.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: Much effort, much prosperity.
Author: Euripides

Quote: I've realized the extraordinary power of sports to heal, unite and inspire. I believe the Olympics will serve as the ultimate platform to provide positive changes and I hope to inspire all of Japan through my strong showing there.
Author: Kohei Uchimura

Quote: We don't appreciate the value of humor sometimes.
Author: Janet Evanovich

Quote: I have a deep love for life and my fellow human beings. I try to understand everything that everybody does, even if it seems wrong to me.
Author: Steve Vai

Quote: I have a deep love for life and my fellow human beings. I try to understand everything that everybody does, even if it seems wrong to me.
Author: Steve Vai

Quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
Author: John Keats

Quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: I can't give you a sure-fire formula for success, but I can give you a formula for failure: try to please everybody all the time.
Author: Herbert Bayard Swope

Quote: I can't give you a sure-fire formula for success, but I can give you a formula for failure: try to please everybody all the time.
Author: Herbert Bayard Swope

Quote: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
Author: W. Clement Stone

Quote: I write some country music. There's a song called 'I Hope You Dance.' Incredible. I was going to write that poem; somebody beat me to it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: You can get through very serious and sometimes horrible and sometimes embarrassing and very awkward situations with humor. It gives us a way out.
Author: Janet Evanovich

Quote: When we think of the ideal, we do not add virtue to virtue, but think of Jesus Christ, so that the standard of human life is no longer a code, but a character.
Author: E. Stanley Jones

Quote: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Our worldly successes cannot be guaranteed, but our ability to achieve spiritual success is entirely up to us, thanks to the grace of God. The best advice I know is to give is to give those worldly things your best but never your all - reserve the ultimate hope for the only one who can grant it.
Author: Mitt Romney

Quote: Our worldly successes cannot be guaranteed, but our ability to achieve spiritual success is entirely up to us, thanks to the grace of God. The best advice I know is to give is to give those worldly things your best but never your all - reserve the ultimate hope for the only one who can grant it.
Author: Mitt Romney

Quote: Reading 'Youth in Revolt' might have ruined my career because suddenly I wanted to abandon all the emotional truth of something and just go out far on a literary limb with completely implausible things that relied completely on voice and humor. And what saved me is realizing that I couldn't do that very well.
Author: Rob Thomas

Quote: People ask for this life, but they don't really understand what comes with it. People just see the outside and that looks good - big houses, cars, girls, but you never see how the person is feeling deep down inside. Me personally, being a man, I'm going to feel better displaying all of this and pouring my heart out on each record.
Author: Bow Wow

Quote: Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Painting is self-discovery. Every good artist paints what he is.
Author: Jackson Pollock

Quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: The reason I never give up hope is because everything is so basically hopeless.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: A lot of people say, 'Hey, God doesn't have a sense of humor.' Yes, He does. God has a great sense of humor.
Author: Si Robertson

Quote: I have been insane on the subject of moneymaking all my life.
Author: Cornelius Vanderbilt

Quote: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.
Author: Josh Billings

Quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: Success or failure depends more upon attitude than upon capacity successful men act as though they have accomplished or are enjoying something. Soon it becomes a reality. Act, look, feel successful, conduct yourself accordingly, and you will be amazed at the positive results.
Author: William James

Quote: I'm not the kind of person who likes to shout out my personal issues from the rooftops, but with my bipolar becoming public, I hope fellow sufferers will know it's completely controllable. I hope I can help remove any stigma attached to it, and that those who don't have it under control will seek help with all that is available to treat it.
Author: Catherine Zeta-Jones

Quote: I don't have a disregard for my reader in humor pieces.
Author: Ian Frazier

Quote: I get very little sleep. But I try to stay constantly busy. My fear is that if I stop working I'll, like, die. So throughout my life I've always tried to remain busy, and I sort of know no other way. I think if my heart rate slowed it would affect my constitution, strangely. I've been trained to do that.
Author: Matthew Gray Gubler

Quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has had to overcome while trying to succeed.
Author: Booker T. Washington

Quote: There is no reason why challenging themes and engaging stories have to be mutually exclusive - in fact, each can fuel the other. As a filmmaker, I want to entertain people first and foremost. If out of that comes a greater awareness and understanding of a time or a circumstance, then the hope is that change can happen.
Author: Edward Zwick

Quote: The only way I could get comfortable around people was to make them laugh. I was an obedient girl, and humor was my one form of rebellion. I used comedy to deflect. Like, 'Hey, check out my zit!' - you know, making fun of yourself before someone else has a chance to.
Author: Tina Fey

Quote: Who will tell whether one happy moment of love or the joy of breathing or walking on a bright morning and smelling the fresh air, is not worth all the suffering and effort which life implies.
Author: Erich Fromm

Quote: Black as the devil, hot as hell, pure as an angel, sweet as love.
Author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand

Quote: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.
Author: Stella Adler

Quote: I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Failure is not an option. Everyone has to succeed.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: To me, one of the best faces America has ever projected is the face of a Peace Corps volunteer. That face symbolizes this country: young, curious, brimming with idealism and hope - and a real, honest compassion.
Author: Teresa Heinz

Quote: Bathroom humor, fart, and poo poo humor in movies gets a laugh. It's a pretty easy audience, and that's been around for ages.
Author: Selma Blair

Quote: Life's like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Art is the concrete representation of our most subtle feelings.
Author: Agnes Martin

Quote: We loved with a love that was more than love.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: If you wish to succeed in life, make perseverance your bosom friend, experience your wise counselor, caution your elder brother, and hope your guardian genius.
Author: Joseph Addison

Quote: If you wish to succeed in life, make perseverance your bosom friend, experience your wise counselor, caution your elder brother, and hope your guardian genius.
Author: Joseph Addison

Quote: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
Author: Joseph Conrad

Quote: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
Author: Joseph Conrad

Quote: He was just trying to tease me - I knew that later - but he said he'd have to leave because it wasn't fair to have anyone in the room who was going to make fun of what he had to say. He had a good sense of humor, really.
Author: Fay Wray

Quote: Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead.
Author: Morihei Ueshiba

Quote: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.
Author: William Morris

Quote: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: There is no success without hardship.
Author: Sophocles

Quote: Yesterday I was a dog. Today I'm a dog. Tomorrow I'll probably still be a dog. Sigh! There's so little hope for advancement.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Yesterday I was a dog. Today I'm a dog. Tomorrow I'll probably still be a dog. Sigh! There's so little hope for advancement.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: I got my sense of humor from my grandmother. You know, my grandmother was very funny.
Author: Paul Mooney

Quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
Author: E. M. Forster

Quote: Summer is a great time to visit art museums, which offer the refreshing rinse of swimming pools - only instead of cool water, you immerse yourself in art.
Author: Jerry Saltz

Quote: Man must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
Author: Christopher Morley

Quote: The secret is not to give up hope. It's very hard not to because if you're really doing something worthwhile I think you will be pushed to the brink of hopelessness before you come through the other side.
Author: George Lucas

Quote: Humor, for me, is really a gate of departure. It's a way of enticing a reader into a poem so that less funny things can take place later. It really is not an end in itself, but a means to an end.
Author: Billy Collins

Quote: There is a very fine line between loving life and being greedy for it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quote: If you have no critics you'll likely have no success.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: The essence of optimism is that it takes no account of the present, but it is a source of inspiration, of vitality and hope where others have resigned; it enables a man to hold his head high, to claim the future for himself and not to abandon it to his enemy.
Author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

Quote: I'm lucky that my real-life Mom has both a great sense of humor about herself and an amazing ability to slip into complete denial if the subject matter gets a little too close to home.
Author: Cathy Guisewite

Quote: Nearly all the best things that came to me in life have been unexpected, unplanned by me.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives.
Author: C. S. Lewis
